intro: Carludovica humilis, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its heliotropic growth habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces vibrant blue to purple flowers that open in the morning and close by midday. It has heart-shaped leaves and can grow up to 3 meters in length, often climbing or trailing along the ground. Carludovica humilis is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its beauty.
